feed.title: Leon’s Blog(n)
feed.subtitle: Just some math notes, piano recordings, and animations

entry.title: Saw Buskers!
entry.content: Wanted to go see a jazz show tonight but unfortunately the tickets were sold out. Luckily, there were some buskers on the street. The band was called “Just Fine”, and they were a really R&B band.
entry.summary: Wanted to go see a jazz show tonight but unfortunately the tickets were sold out. Luckily, there were some buskers on the street. The band was called “Just Fine”, and they were a really R&B band.

entry.title: Halloween and Harrowing Heat equation
entry.content:
Made an animation for the finite element method with time dependence!

It also looks cool when you plot it out with time as the third dimension (Thanks Leonidas for the suggestion).

I then varied the initial condition.
It starts at $u(x, 0) = \sin(0x)$ and ends up at $\sin(5\pi x)$ over the duration of the video.

Auto covid form completer seems to work with schtasks, though it seems my computer needs to be on for it to run. Hopefully, I can run it in the background with some permissions, so I can leave my computer asleep

Helped my friend with a halloween murder mystery party script. I helped with some of the ideas. Was fun and tiring, as the players went in directions we did not anticipate. Also saw a lot of plotholes, its interesting to see the parts that needed more speficiation, generally crucial clues needed more details as player would make things up that weren’t exactly true, and such errors would cascade and cover up the real killers.
entry.summary: Made an animation for the finite element method with time dependence! It also looks cool when you plot it out with time as the third dimension (Thanks Leonidas for the suggestion). I then varied the initial condition. It starts at $u(x, 0) = \sin(0x)$ and ends up at $\sin(5\pi x)$ over the duration of the video. Auto covid form completer seems to work with schtasks, though it seems my computer needs to be on for it to run. Hopefully, I can run it in the background with some permissions, so I can leave my computer asleep Helped my friend with a halloween murder mystery party script. I helped with some of the ideas. Was fun and tiring, as the players went in directions we did not anticipate. Also saw a lot of plotholes, its interesting to see the parts that needed more speficiation, generally crucial clues needed more details as player would make things up that weren’t exactly true, and such errors would cascade and cover up the real killers.

entry.title: Reading Week, Part 2!
entry.content:
Halfway through reading week.

Today I worked on a possible research project, specifically the Integer Chebyshev Problem, which I think is a cool optimzation problem. It’ll be interesting to see if they are any real world applications.

I’m trying to get the js script I wrote last week to automatically run once every day, but I don’t like using Windows Automatic Scheduler. Hopefully I can find a better script automater.
entry.summary: Halfway through reading week. Today I worked on a possible research project, specifically the Integer Chebyshev Problem, which I think is a cool optimzation problem. It’ll be interesting to see if they are any real world applications. I’m trying to get the js script I wrote last week to automatically run once every day, but I don’t like using Windows Automatic Scheduler. Hopefully I can find a better script automater.

entry.title: Reading Week
entry.content:
It’s finally reading week.

Didn’t do much today, but made a js script to autofill the self assessment form we have to do.

Also started kpop dancing!
entry.summary: It’s finally reading week. Didn’t do much today, but made a js script to autofill the self assessment form we have to do. Also started kpop dancing!

entry.title: It’s the start of the third week of school

link.title: It's the start of the third week of school

entry.content:
Happy Mid Autumn Festival!

I have some new ideas for projects, god knows if I ever finish any of them xD.

-Pdes heat/fluids game (ice age end of the world apocalypse where you assign heat sources in an apartment to keep people alive), planning to use ngsolve library.

-Text based job assignment fantasy game, planning to use gurobi to solve job assignment ip.

-Apply finite element method to black scholes

I’m also looking at one of my supervisor’s papers. Yo, base golden ratio number systems are cool.

In base , where is the larger root of i.e numbers are written , so it’s the normal decimal system except we have instead of $10$. It is also similar to binary, as are only allowed to be or .

Unlike the base 10 system, there are many different ways to write the same number (Infinite ways according to Erdős).

For example, the number in base can be written as in base , and there are trickier expansions such as $0.110110110110 … $ and $0.10101011010$. These can be shown with a little algebra.

A little algebra showing the above $$ \begin{align} \phi^2 - \phi - 1 &= 0 \text{ start with quadratic equation} \\ 1 - \frac{1}{\phi} - \frac{1}{\phi^2} &= 0 \text{ divide both sides by } \phi \\ 1 &= \frac{1}{\phi} + \frac{1}{\phi^2} \text{ rearrange, note that this would be } 0.11 \text{ in base } \phi \\ &= \frac{1}{\phi} + \frac{\frac{1}{\phi} + \frac{1}{\phi^2}}{\phi^2} \text{ sub in previous line for the 1 in the numerator of }\frac{1}{\phi^4} \\ &= \frac{1}{\phi} + \frac{1}{\phi^3} + \frac{1}{\phi^4} \text{simplify, note that this would be } 0.1011 \text{ in base } \phi \\ &= \frac{1}{\phi} + \frac{1}{\phi^3} + \frac{\frac{1}{\phi} + \frac{1}{\phi^2} }{\phi^4} \text{ repeat substitution process always on the greatest power term} \\ &= \frac{1}{\phi} + \frac{1}{\phi^3} + \frac{1}{\phi^5} + \frac{1}{\phi^6} \\ & \vdots \end{align} $$ which then becomes $$0.10101010...$$ in base $\phi$. Other expansions such as $$0.110110110...$$ can be shown with a similar method, though you would replace the $1$ with $\frac{1}{\phi^2} - \frac{1}{\phi}$ in a different term (not always the greatest power one).
entry.summary: Happy Mid Autumn Festival! I have some new ideas for projects, god knows if I ever finish any of them xD. -Pdes heat/fluids game (ice age end of the world apocalypse where you assign heat sources in an apartment to keep people alive), planning to use ngsolve library. -Text based job assignment fantasy game, planning to use gurobi to solve job assignment ip. -Apply finite element method to black scholes I’m also looking at one of my supervisor’s papers. Yo, base golden ratio number systems are cool. In base , where is the larger root of i.e numbers are written , so it’s the normal decimal system except we have instead of $10$. It is also similar to binary, as are only allowed to be or . Unlike the base 10 system, there are many different ways to write the same number (Infinite ways according to Erdős). For example, the number in base can be written as in base , and there are trickier expansions such as $0.110110110110 … $ and $0.10101011010$. These can be shown with a little algebra. A little algebra showing the above $$ \begin{align} \phi^2 - \phi - 1 &= 0 \text{ start with quadratic equation} \\ 1 - \frac{1}{\phi} - \frac{1}{\phi^2} &= 0 \text{ divide both sides by } \phi \\ 1 &= \frac{1}{\phi} + \frac{1}{\phi^2} \text{ rearrange, note that this would be } 0.11 \text{ in base } \phi \\ &= \frac{1}{\phi} + \frac{\frac{1}{\phi} + \frac{1}{\phi^2}}{\phi^2} \text{ sub in previous line for the 1 in the numerator of }\frac{1}{\phi^4} \\ &= \frac{1}{\phi} + \frac{1}{\phi^3} + \frac{1}{\phi^4} \text{simplify, note that this would be } 0.1011 \text{ in base } \phi \\ &= \frac{1}{\phi} + \frac{1}{\phi^3} + \frac{\frac{1}{\phi} + \frac{1}{\phi^2} }{\phi^4} \text{ repeat substitution process always on the greatest power term} \\ &= \frac{1}{\phi} + \frac{1}{\phi^3} + \frac{1}{\phi^5} + \frac{1}{\phi^6} \\ & \vdots \end{align} $$ which then becomes $$0.10101010...$$ in base $\phi$. Other expansions such as $$0.110110110...$$ can be shown with a similar method, though you would replace the $1$ with $\frac{1}{\phi^2} - \frac{1}{\phi}$ in a different term (not always the greatest power one).

entry.title: End of Second week of classes

link.title: End of Second week of classes

entry.content:
This week is coming to a close. Worked on my Numerical algs assignment and made a little animation for the first question and the 2D version for the next question.

The former is the Finite Difference solution to on the domain with boundary conditions.

The latter is the Finite Difference solution to on the domain with boundary conditions.
entry.summary: This week is coming to a close. Worked on my Numerical algs assignment and made a little animation for the first question and the 2D version for the next question. The former is the Finite Difference solution to on the domain with boundary conditions. The latter is the Finite Difference solution to on the domain with boundary conditions.

entry.title: Second week of classes
entry.content: It’s the second week of classes! Still mainly syllabus stuff. Messed around with the starter code of the Computational PDEs course to make this.
entry.summary: It’s the second week of classes! Still mainly syllabus stuff. Messed around with the starter code of the Computational PDEs course to make this.

entry.title: School starts in 2 Weeks!
entry.content:
Read the Leviathan series! Excited for Leviathan falls this fall.

I also read Ao Ashi, cool soccer manga like Blue Lock.

Been learning “Autumn Leaves in 10 styles” on the piano. Learned the first 3 styles so far, 7 left. The funky latin looks fun.
entry.summary: Read the Leviathan series! Excited for Leviathan falls this fall. I also read Ao Ashi, cool soccer manga like Blue Lock. Been learning “Autumn Leaves in 10 styles” on the piano. Learned the first 3 styles so far, 7 left. The funky latin looks fun.

entry.title: School starts in 3 weeks!
entry.content:
I’ve learned a new song called Tea for Two which was arranged by Pierre-Yves Plat and composed by Vincent Youmans.

Also been trying to get my old physics assignment up on the blog. It’s written in C++, so I’m trying to get Google NACL to work but its making be me pretty salty so far …

It’s written in C++, so I’m trying to get Google NACL to work but its making be me pretty salty so far …

entry.title: John 3-7. You should not be surprised at my saying, You must be born again.

link.title: John 3-7. You should not be surprised at my saying, You must be born again.

entry.content: Restarting blog. Let’s see how long I can keep this updated for. This summer I didn’t do that much, but there’s some animations I will show off! I also played a lot of piano as well!
